{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3588430,"name":"","username":"Akshaj_K","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-11T15:47:53.751Z","cooked":"

Our team has been using the limelight’s default calibration for this year. I could calibrate it by following limelight’s ChArUco camera calibration, and I’ve even tried calibrating with this. I only had time to get around 40 valid snapshots, but I didn’t go through with it because we were able to work well with the default calibration. Would putting the effort to get more snapshots and calibrate the limelight properly be worth it? How much of a difference would a custom calibration make?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-11T15:47:53.751Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498838,"topic_slug":"limelight-calibration-is-it-worth-it","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63182,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Student Programmer | 4611"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3588492,"name":"Tinnittin","username":"Tinnittin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tinnittin/{size}/148604_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-11T16:15:06.048Z","cooked":"

How are you using the limelight? Are you “servoing” or doing pose estimation?

Check out the Why Does This Matter section here:

docs.limelightvision.io

ChArUco Camera Calibration | Limelight Documentation

Why Does This Matter?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-11T16:15:06.048Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":165,"readers_count":164,"score":38.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498838,"topic_slug":"limelight-calibration-is-it-worth-it","display_username":"Tinnittin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.limelightvision.io/docs/docs-limelight/getting-started/performing-charuco-camera-calibration#why-does-this-matter","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"ChArUco Camera Calibration | Limelight Documentation","clicks":25}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2046 Mentor. Opinions are my own."},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3588514,"name":"","username":"Akshaj_K","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-11T16:20:52.796Z","cooked":"

We use pose estimation; we don’t do any “servoing”. The main reason for exploring this is because our estimated pose jitters a lot (upto 0.6 meters off) during rotation. We resolve this by scaling our standard deviation by our rotational velocity and tag area. I’m wondering if calibrating the limelight would be help this.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-11T16:20:52.796Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":35.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":498838,"topic_slug":"limelight-calibration-is-it-worth-it","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"username":"Tinnittin","name":"Tinnittin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tinnittin/{size}/148604_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63182,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Student Programmer | 4611"},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3588527,"name":"Drew Williams","username":"jreneew2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jreneew2/{size}/135239_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-11T16:24:28.961Z","cooked":"

If you are doing 3d estimation, I would argue calibration is a strict requirement. The differences in lenses between individual cameras are significant enough that you need to.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-11T16:24:28.961Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":41.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":498838,"topic_slug":"limelight-calibration-is-it-worth-it","display_username":"Drew Williams","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Akshaj_K","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/71c47a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21777,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":" 2053 Head Mentor"},"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3588590,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-11T16:37:30.260Z","cooked":"

Every camera must be individually calibrated if you want to have accurate 3D pose tracking.

@asid61 I believe commented on the importance of calibration and comparing it to the default LimeLight calibration and found the default can be off by upwards of 5% IIRC.

Only time you might be able to get away with not calibrating is if you only care about 2D tracking (getting an XY coordinate of where the tag is in the frame, not estimating your pose relative to the tag).

Thank you very much, I’ll definitely prioritize this more. We are also using a printed paper taped to a board for this, but seeing how important it seems, is it recommended to invent in a proper board? The one in limelight documentation seems expensive, is there a cheaper or better board anywhere else. If not, we can just buy the one limelight recommends.

These will be fine:

https://www.etsy.com/listing/1820746969/charuco-calibration-target

I got the small ones, but I’m sure the big ones are good too.
